definitions: An Aboriginal warrior and resistance leader from the Bidjigal clan of the Eora people in the Sydney region of Australia.
Known for his resistance against the early British colonial settlement in New South Wales during the late 18th and early 19th centuries.
examples: Pemulwuy led a sustained guerrilla campaign.
The legacy of Pemulwuy is still celebrated today.
Pemulwuy was a formidable opponent to the British.
